Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: Fine, fine...

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: ...You. Can it be? The eyes in the mirror look away. And then back.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Where are they taking them?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: --Shveig! Shveig!

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Just shut up! Please...

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Some food...?

Speaker: walencki
Dialogue: They are looking for you people. The two brothers glance nervously around.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Zus. Let's go. As they retreat toward the woods, Zus warns the farmer.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: We'll be back.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And no news of my brothers?

Speaker: rifka
Dialogue: They are used to trouble, they'll be all right.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: If you stay, you'll have to go to the ghetto.

Speaker: rifka
Dialogue: I can get false papers and pass as a gentile. So can you. Tuvia shakes his head, no. He finishes dressing. Theirs is a relationship long past passion.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I need to see to my family. Will you come?

Speaker: rifka
Dialogue: To the country? No.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Papa-- Gottenyu... Flies buzz about dead LIVESTOCK. A WOMAN'S BODY lies nearby.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Aron. The boy  recoils. He is disoriented and WILL NOT

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Stop it... But Asael is lost in a confusion of grief and panic.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: If I was a German you are dead.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Tuvia! Asael leaps up to embrace him as if he were salvation itself.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Big brother returns. Tuvia and Zus look at each other warily.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Are you going back to the army?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: There is no more army. Asael worships his big brother.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Hope at least you killed a few. Tuvia just stares at him.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: What is it like? To be in a war?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: It wasn't war. It was something else. Zus eyes him carefully.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Horodysze. Hiding in a cellar. I'll bring her when it is safe. Where is Rifka?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: In Novgrudok. She wouldn't leave.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: You are still separated?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: She is still my wife.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Your rich wife. Zus chews with the open-mouthed relish of a peasant.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No. Do you?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Is there anything left to eat? Only a few potatoes in Asael's bag. WORMS writhe among them.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Zus finished the last of the sausage. Tuvia glares at Zus, who glares back. Sibling rivals.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Stankowicz' farm is closest.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: He has dogs.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Fuck the dogs. Wilencki then.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You think Wilencki is going to give us food?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No. We take it.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: We...Take...It.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And he tells the police.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: I have run from the police my whole life. Do you really think it's a good time to stop? A moment of decision. Who holds the balance of power?

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: We know these woods. They'll never find us in here. Tuvia looks at his brothers. He has been outvoted.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: We want food. Be quick about it!

Speaker: walencki
Dialogue: You again!

Speaker: walencki
Dialogue: Sure, sure. Take what you want... Tuvia begins to stuff provisions into a sack.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Where is your gun, farmer?

Speaker: walencki
Dialogue: I have no gun. Zus grabs a dinner plate and SMASHES IT IN THE FARMER'S

Speaker: walencki
Dialogue: Please... Zus kicks him.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: He's lying. He kicks him again. The farmer begins to weep.

Speaker: walencki
Dialogue: Up there... Zus kicks the man aside. Above the stove is an old rifle. Zus grabs it, points it at the farmer.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: We were never here.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: He was willing to help us.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: He's lucky I didn't crush his head.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: This is your plan? To terrorize every anti-Semite in Belorussia?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No. Some I will kill.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Ah...

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: You know what Papa would do when you did that at table... Tuvia smacks Zus on the head, taking on a gruff voice.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Peasant.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: I can't believe Papa's dead.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Bernicki.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: The police captain?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We don't know he did it.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: He always had it in for Papa.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We don't know he did it.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: So we will go and ask him if he did.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Koscik has a pistol. He showed it to me once.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: One pistol isn't enough. We need rifles. Machine guns.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Machine guns? You're going to take on the whole German army?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Just because you didn't... The SOUND of footsteps. Zus jumps up cocking the rifle. ARON emerges from the trees. And then, behind him, THE SURVIVORS he discovered among the corpses. THE MIDDLE-AGED MAN holds a teenage GIRL by one hand and carries his younger daughter.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Set her down. The man lowers the child to the ground. She isn't moving.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Where did you find them? Aron still won't speak. Asael addresses the other girl.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I'll go ask Koscik for food.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: And the pistol.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And the pistol. Without another word, he starts off.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Remember to say please.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: I have only four bullets.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I cannot thank you enough. They sit in Koscik's warmly-lit kitchen. Koscik's WIFE stands silently by the stove, glaring at Tuvia.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Your father was a good man.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: He said the same of you. Tuvia can't help but notice Koscik's wife giving him the evil eye. Koscik produces a bottle of vodka.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Ignore the bitch.  Bitch-- Do you want vodka? His wife just glares at him.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Working late, boys.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Hunting Jews. Our new bosses are very organized. Koscik offers the bottle.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Hunting can work up a thirst.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Fifteen in one day. The council is offering a year's free tax for every one you turn in. -

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: A Jew is worth that much? Do you pay more for a fat one? They laugh appreciatively.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Caught five of them hiding in a ditch. Smelled so bad I was afraid the Germans wouldn't want them.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Maybe for a reduced price. More laughter. More vodka.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: You know the Bielski's?

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: We missed two when we visited the parents.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Anybody caught helping them is in for it. You know this, Koscik?

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Do I look like an idiot? Don't answer so quickly... More laughter. The Police Captain looks at his watch. Yawns.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Been at it since dawn. The wife doesn't like these long nights. He tries to hand back the bottle to Koscik.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Keep it.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Bribing an officer of the law? Maybe you have more of this black market vodka hidden in the barn?

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Take a look. And clean out the cow shit while you're back there. The policeman laughs and climbs back into the car.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: You'll keep your eyes open, yes?

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Good hunting.

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: --If the laborers find them tomorrow, I will be denounced--

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do with--

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: Take them into the forest--

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: --And feed them how? I can't care for my own family. Behind them, several of the REFUGEES have emerged from their hiding place. They stare at Tuvia balefully.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Those men? They were the ones who killed my parents?

Speaker: koscik
Dialogue: You people. Why is it so fucking hard to be friends with a Jew? They embrace.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Imagine being one. Tuvia leads his motley band toward the woods.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: You sat in back. Tuvia just looks at him.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I thought you were dead.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: I am at least half-dead.  I heard them speaking of your parents. I am very sorry. Tuvia shakes his head.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Zus. He's with the other two.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: You are hiding here? In the forest? Tuvia nods.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: For a dumb schoolboy, you mean.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: My whole life I presumed to teach others the right way to live. I had no doubt: this is God's way, this isn't. You'll forgive me if recent events have somewhat shaken my resolve.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: It is just like school, I don't know what you're talking about.  Teacher...Come... Come. (gesturing to the

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Here... You're not hungry? Aron doesn't respond.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: He saw. Things.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: I send you for food and you bring more mouths to feed.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You send me?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Did you at least get the gun?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Only four bullets.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Then we'll have to make them count. Zus heads for the food. Asael is trying to start a fire but the kindling is wet.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Here... Shimon takes a book from his coat, rips out pages covered in Hebrew and crumples them into the fire. They burst into flame.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: You worked late. The man nods, his mouth full of food.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: ...Fucking SS never sleeps... The door OPENS slowly. They all look up.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You know who I am? The policeman says nothing. His wife is instantly terrified. One of the SONS stands. Tuvia turns the gun on him.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: ...what are you talking about?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You have no idea what I'm talking about...

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: If they say find someone, I find him. It's my job.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: To find Jews.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Or lose my job.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And it's a good job, isn't it? You like your job.

Speaker: policeman
Dialogue: I was always fair with your family. ...Everyone knew you were smuggling this and that. But I looked the other way.  ...Ask your father.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: My father? You don't talk about my father... Tuvia places the pistol against the man's forehead.

Speaker: police captain
Dialogue: Please.... I beg you... One of the man's SONS makes a move toward Tuvia. Tuvia SHOOTS him in the chest. His mother SCREAMS. The Policeman suddenly starts to stand. Tuvia backs away, shoots him. And then the other son. It is all over in seconds.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Kill me, too! Tuvia should indeed kill her, too. To avoid being identified.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Tell them who did this.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Riboynoy shel oylam, riboynoy shel oylam...  Lord of the universe, forgive me, I have murdered -- but they were monsters and did not deserve to live.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Only one bullet left.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: His sons. Zus nods his approval.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: How was it?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: To kill them. It was good, no?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Shut up. Tuvia stares into the fire. He is dirty and tired. Zus looks around.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: What are we going to do with these others?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I don't know--

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: The women will slow us down. And your old teacher--

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You're afraid he's going to beat you for forgetting your homework.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: We have to be able to keep moving, and quickly.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I agree. But they're here. They consider their predicament.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Alright. But no more.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No more.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I know. I know... Tamara, you remember Cousin Zus. Please, go sit down by the fire. And this is Lazar -- Isabel's youngest... Tamara is pleasant-looking but emotionally wounded.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Tuvia, I have pity for them all,

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: They are family.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: And how will we feed this family?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We'll water the soup. One of the new arrivals is a DARK-HAIRED BEAUTY. Tuvia and Zus watch her pass. Zus is particularly interested.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: And this one, is she family?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No. By the fire, the veterans pepper the newcomers with

Speaker: miriam
Dialogue: You are from Lida! Is Isadore Korein alive?

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: There are so many in the ghetto, I don't know...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Does anyone have news from Vilna?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Fuck me! Have you never used a hammer?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Uh. No.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: What is it you do, then?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: I suppose...you'd have to say...I was...am...an intellectual.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: This is a job?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: I published a small magazine... actually a journal...well, more like a pamphlet. Zus passes them, his arm around the dark-haired beauty.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Tuvia, this is Rona. Rona is my forest wife.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I see. Congratulations. Zus winks and walks past. Malbin and Tuvia watch them.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Interesting concept.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: As long as his village wife stays in hiding.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Nice to know there are some things even Hitler can't destroy.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Hello, boys, what can we do for you?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: These little shits are holding us up. The Young Man motions his partner to take Zus's rifle.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: This is all the food we have. You are welcome to share.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No. We're the Gestapo, you little shit.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Come. Sit. Put down your guns.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Or perhaps you'd prefer I shove them up your ass.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Where are you from? The young man glares at Zus. Then, to Tuvia:

Speaker: peretz
Dialogue: We haven't eaten in two days. My name is Peretz, this is Jacov.

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: Two days ago there were three thousand Jews in Horodyszcze. Now there are fifty. Me and him, we hid in a wall.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: You know a woman there, Sonia Bielski? The men look at one another.

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: We knew her. Zus can hardly bring himself to ask the next question.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: ...There was a child. Jacov shakes his head. Sorry. Zus leans his head against a tree. After a moment he begins to BEAT HIS HEAD against it until BLOOD pours down his face.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: His family. Tuvia puts his arms around his brother. Zus's shoulders begin to heave. Soon his body convulses with deep wracking sobs. He is absolutely unself-conscious in his grief.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: So many dead.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Mama. Papa. Their heads are close together, their faces wet with tears.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: I thought they'd be safe. I should have been with them.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: I could have protected them. Tuvia just holds him. He, too, is crying quietly.

Speaker: peretz
Dialogue: We are looking for partisans.

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: What is the name of your otriad? Tuvia laughs ruefully.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: What is an 'otriad?'

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: An armed brigade.

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: We heard the Russians are beginning to organize.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Here?

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: And also in the Lipicanska.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Then we are the Bielski Otriad. You want to join?

Speaker: peretz
Dialogue: The Russians are fighters.

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: --But you need a gun to join them. Without a gun you are nothing. They sabotage railroads and kill Germans.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: --we must get what we need without killing. We can't make more enemies-- Zus concentrates on opening the breach.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Blood for blood. You had your revenge.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And I can still see their faces.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: 'Vengeance is mine.' Who said that?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: So this is God's work you're doing, Zussie?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No. Only YOU can play God. Save a few lives, take a few others...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We cannot become...like them.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: If only...  Are you coming with us or not?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Us?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Peretz and Jacov.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You are making the decisions now? A stand-off. Zus stares back at him. The struggle for command has grown more obvious.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: My truck! WHO DID THIS TO MY TRUCK? Tuvia, Zus and the others appear out the shadows.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We did.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: peretz
Dialogue: Look--! MORE HEADLIGHTS fast approaching.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Hide! Everyone! They all scramble back into the ditch, dragging the dead courier with them.

Speaker: private
Dialogue: It's one of ours, but no one is here. Maybe he was drunk? From the car, an SERGEANT yells a reply.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Move it off the road before the convoy passes. I'll report the sonuvabitch. As the soldier drags the bike off the road, AN OFFICER steps out of the car and lights a cigarette. He's followed by the Sergeant. He carries a Schmeisser SUBMACHINE GUN dangling from his shoulder.

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: I got him! Peretz and Asael can now catch up to the soldier.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Stupid! The gunfire could be heard for miles.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: He was pissing on my head. Zus is high from the killing, covered in the dead man's blood. He begins calling out orders.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Hurry--!

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: They were on their way to a party! They toss one bottle to Zus and another to Tuvia.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Welcome to Belarus, herr Henkel. A CHAMPAGNE CORK POPS as Peretz and Jacov toast their victory.

Speaker: peretz
Dialogue: Now we are real Partisans...

Speaker: jacov
Dialogue: To the Bielski Otriad!

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Into the fields! RUN! Tuvia pulls Peretz off the road, but Jacov reloads his rifle and begins to FIRE at the approaching trucks.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Zus. His rifle. Zus races back to pick up Peretz's weapon.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Asael... He rips the rifle from Zus's hands. For a moment we think he's going to go back after him. Instead, he wedges the rifle into a tree-trunk and takes careful aim...

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: They thought you were bringing food. Tuvia just stares at him.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: I don't understand. Tuvia says nothing. Nearby, a child cries in hunger.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Again I have no idea what you are talking about. Around them, the beseeching eyes of so many hungry faces.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: I think you do.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You are the Bielski's? A MAN stands in the clearing. BEN ZION GULKOWITZ is tall, well muscled, a rifle strapped over his shoulder.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: How'd you get past the Lazar?

Speaker: ben zion
Dialogue: Who? Zus stands unsteadily, then lurches into the woods, leaning on an occasional tree for support. He finds the erstwhile sentry --LAZAR -- ambling toward him.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: You shit! You worthless shit! Zus punches him, knocking him the ground. In a sloppy, drunken frenzy, Zus SLAPS him again.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Enough!

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: He walked right by you! Someone could have been killed! Tuvia pulls Zus off him.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I said, enough!  Get up! Get up!

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: If we were real partisans he'd be shot.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: He made a mistake!

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: MISTAKE! We cannot make mistakes! As Zus goes for Lazar again, Tuvia roughly PULLS HIM OFF. Zus goes flying, tripping over, landing on his ass.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: That's right, Zus. No mistakes. Like last night.  First they will torture Asael...and then they will hang him. Tuvia walks away, leaving his brother on the ground.

Speaker: ben zion
Dialogue: You are Tuvia Bielski.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You know me?

Speaker: ben zion
Dialogue: I am Ben Zion Gulkowitz. Ben Zion is besieged by questions about friends and family.

Speaker: miriam
Dialogue: Pardon me, you are from Vilna. My sister lives on Passaya Street.

Speaker: ben zion
Dialogue: The SD came without warning. Hundreds were taken. No one knows where.

Speaker: miriam
Dialogue: My poor sister...dear God, no... Meanwhile, Peretz's MOANING ceases. A woman grumbles:

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: At least here we are safe.

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: There at least we had hope...

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: No. Here, we have hope. A FEW MORE join in, grumbling their dissatisfaction. Others take the opposite position. These are Jews, after all, and arguing is a revered sport and a pastime. It escalates.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I know we have no food. But tomorrow... tomorrow will be another mission.

Speaker: rona
Dialogue: Look what happened the last time.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: That was a mistake! But the mistakes we made will not be made again! More objections. Tuvia must raise his voice to be heard.

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Better security. Better at getting food and information-- (talking over their

Speaker: aron
Dialogue: Or Asael. Everyone stares. It is the first time Aron has spoken.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Or Asael. We... We-- (trying to hold it

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: The poorest farmer has more than us.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: True. But what I am saying is... what I mean is... We are not thieves.  We have all chosen this -- to live free, like human beings, for as long as we can. Each day of freedom is an act of faith. And if we die trying to live, at least we die like human beings. His mission statement. A vision of their future. Everyone nods in mute acknowledgement. Zus lowers his head. The shift in power between them has occurred. Tuvia has emerged as the undisputed leader.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Now. They leave their cover and approach warily, guns at the ready.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Hello. She refuses to be flattered. In Russian:

Speaker: koscik's wife
Dialogue: In the barn.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Koscik, put your pants back on and leave those sheep alone. He steps into the shadows to find:

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: koscik's wife
Dialogue: Come.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Thank God.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Zus.... ZUSSIE... I can't breathe. Zus lets him go and Asael reaches back into the root cellar.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Asael... Well, well..

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: koscik's wife
Dialogue: Go.

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: --and then we fell into this horrible bog. Chaya saved me. Honestly, I can't swim at all.

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: We must have got lost a dozen times. I was absolutely resigned to die.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: Tell him, Chaya. Was it not the absolute worst? And that farmer, Mr. Koscik, kept making the most vulgar jokes, he said any girl who-- As they continue out of earshot, it appears as though Zus would be happy to listen for hours.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: You're trying to tell me all politics is meaningless.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: In the West a monster with a little mustache, in the East a monster with a big mustache. This is all I need to know about politics.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Your messiah will have a mustache, too, and a full beard.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: No. The messiahs are all in politics, and they're killing us. Zus unloads two cut and stripped trees.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: What's killing me is all your talking. Back to work. Malbin and Shimon go back to work.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: And Roosevelt? He has no mustache.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: My life in these woods is much easier because of Mr. Roosevelt, thank you.

Dialogue: The others?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Fighters die so that malbushim may live, that's what you believe, yes? Tuvia absorbs the accusation as if taking a punch.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: So you're a communist now, Zus? Zus lays his head back on the seat, closes his eyes.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Communist, Zionist, Manicurist, what difference does it make? You got your medicine.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Come back to us. Zus won't look at him.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: So you remember.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Merciful God, we commit our friends Ben Zion and Krensky to your care. We have no more prayers, no more tears. We have run out of blood. Choose another people We PAN PAST the familiar faces.

Speaker: arkady
Dialogue: Next time, I cut off your nose, pisher. Tuvia emerges from his bunker. He is weaving a bit and his words are slurred.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Whassa problem, Arkady?

Speaker: arkady
Dialogue: Those who risk their lives to bring back food deserve a larger portion than those who risk nothing.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Everyone gets the same portion.

Speaker: arkady
Dialogue: Not when you're serving, pisher. I see you digging to the bottom of the pot for your little forest cutie and her parents...

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: She is my wife!

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Policy is...Same for all. If someone is stealing he'll face consequences. Asael is astonished that Tuvia would go against him in public and embarrassed by his public drunkenness.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: What consequences? Others are closely watching this test of Tuvia's authority.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Reduced rations for one week.  Both of you.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Tuvia, I would never--

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Yes. I know.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Then why am I to be punished...? Tuvia just takes another swallow from his bottle.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: --What?

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: ...that you drink too much and are no longer fit to lead us.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: .Maybe they're right. Asael looks at him. No longer the brother he once idealized.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Zus would have punched him senseless.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Zus.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: I miss him.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: He has made his choice. He reels away toward the woods.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Drink this.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: ...the way they look at me... with their pasty faces. Let them starve, we're all going to die out here anyway.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Not easy being the big boss. Moses was a lonely man when he led us out of bondage.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: ...Moses.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: So I'm a sucker for a biblical allusion. But what is society without leaders. Without leaders, we falter.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I am not a leader.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Neither was Moses, but somehow that seemed to work out.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Lova, what happened? Who did this? Lova sits and buries his head in his hands.

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: Gramov. Two others. I used the officer's latrine.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: For this they beat you? Lova is trying not to weep.

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: They said they wouldn't shit in the same hole as a Jew. Zus gets to his feet.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Forgive me, Commander.

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: Zus. Join us. He offers him a glass of vodka. Zus doesn't take it.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: I want to report the mistreatment of a comrade. Gramov looks up. Zus meets his eye.

Speaker: gramov
Dialogue: I had a perfectly good reason. He is a Jew. The other men LAUGH. Panchenko frowns at Gramov.

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: --and you are an ignorant Tartar.  Ignore him. Here...

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Anti-semitism is a violation of Party discipline. Panchenko sighs. Does he really have to deal with this?

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: He's right, Gramov. Apologize to the Jew.

Speaker: gramov
Dialogue: I apologize, Jew.

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: There. You see?  Now drink up. Zus doesn't know what to do. He accepts the vodka.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: Your fever broke in the night. The medicine helped.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: How long was I asleep?

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: Two days.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And you've nursed me the whole time?

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: Chaya helped.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Did you study nursing at university?

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: We devoted ourselves to more essential knowledge -- like Greek Philosophy and Latin.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I never went to university.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: What kind of work did you do? Before.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: My wife's father had a store. Before the Race Laws.  She is is dead.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Tell me more about university.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: It all feels like a dream. I spent months trying to master Chopin's nocturnes.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I'd love to hear you play.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: You know Chopin?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Who doesn't? Chopin the butcher from Novogrudok.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Thank you, Lilka.

Speaker: lazar
Dialogue: Hey, Arkady This isn't soup, it's piss.

Speaker: arkady
Dialogue: I will piss on your head and you will say it's raining. Eat it. The rest of Lubczanski's cabal laughs. TUVIA emerges from his bunker. The first thing he sees is Asael, whose face is BATTERED AND SWOLLEN.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: What happened? Asael just looks over at the food line -- where Arkady has grabbed Chaya by the waist -- to the delight of the others. Tuvia strides over to them.

Speaker: arkady
Dialogue: New policy. Fighters get better food.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Against my orders...

Speaker: arkady
Dialogue: You are no longer Commander. Sorry. Tuvia nods, considering his remark for a moment.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: As long as I am the leader of this group, you will obey my commands.

Speaker: chaya
Dialogue: Who has the soap? I know there was a little left?

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: Use the sand. It's good for your skin.

Speaker: riva
Dialogue: And what skin! And already married, too! Bella laughs. Chaya splashes her playfully with water.

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: I've turned into a skeleton.

Speaker: chaya
Dialogue: And you were always so worried about staying slim.

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: When we get out of this forest I am going to eat only cake and grow as big as a house. Tamara appears. She's wearing a long overcoat.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: Join us. At least the sun is warm.  Tamara?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I can't, Lilka...  I'm pregnant.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: I had no idea.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I've kept it hidden for months but now it's obvious. No one can know. They move away from the others. Tamara shows her.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: ..Who is the father?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I--- It was when I was escaping. A man with a gun stopped me. I thought he was a Partisan. He told me to follow him and he took me to this place... The memory overwhelms her. She begins to break down.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: He will understand.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: No. You mustn't tell him!

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: I won't. Don't worry.  What are you going to do? Tamara's eyes fill with a new resolve.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I feel this new life inside me. It's the only thing keeping me going. I won't give it up, I'll kill myself. Lilka puts her arm around her.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: You call that a move?

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: I call it an inevitable conclusion based on unimpeachable reasoning.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: I'm thinking about what I'm going to do about it.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Aha! I got him!

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: You didn't get me. You think you got me? How about this?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: A genius maybe. Tuvia has been listening nearby. Aron races into the camp.

Speaker: aron
Dialogue: Tuvia... We SEE Aron whispering in Tuvia's ear.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Asael! Asael comes running.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Lazar spotted another patrol. They're getting closer. Tuvia nods. Suddenly, he HEARS a strange sound. An animal?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Do you hear that?

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: She promises not to take extra food...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: This is against my orders.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: So you are going to shoot her, too? Tuvia stares at her. He has never seen this side of her.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I cannot allow it. He turns away.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: You must let it live!

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: I cannot keep the living alive. Tamara and the man who fathered this child are responsible for its fate.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: She was raped by the Nazis. Tuvia closes his eyes. He is tired of being in charge, tired of being the arbiter of other peoples' fate.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Lilka...

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: I knew what was expected of the women here -- yet you never touched me...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Shhh..

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: I'm not afraid of anything, Tuvia. I'm not even afraid of you. They kiss deeply.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: The Germans are coming into the forest. I don't know what is going to become of us.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: It doesn't matter. If I had stayed in the ghetto I'd be dead. You saved my life.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No. You have saved mine. He reaches for her but before they can begin to make love again-- THE BLANKET DOOR IS PUSHED ASIDE. Malbin is there.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Oh... ..I..... Hello, Lilka.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: Hello, Asael.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: We've caught one.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: He's a scout.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: They're coming for us. Group members have begun to gather around him. They begin to hurl insults -- schtik drek, paskudnyak -- as the hapless man is pushed to his knees.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: We found this in his pouch. He hands Tuvia a sheaf of documents -- including a map.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Entrance points, wetlands, obstacles.  You read this.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: They've assigned an entire division to surround the forest. A tidal wave is coming.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Don't they have a war to fight?

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Assault begins in two days. Passover. How fitting. Meanwhile, some of the group have begun TORMENTING the man.

Speaker: motl
Dialogue: Monster! He kicks him in the head.

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: Bulvan! Shulman PUNCHES him in the face.

Speaker: german courier
Dialogue: Bitte....Bitte...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Did you reach Viktor?

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: He's on his way. The tormenting of the poor courier is gaining intensity.

Speaker: german courier
Dialogue: Ich habe frau und kinder!

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: He says he has a wife and children. Lazar picks up a stick. The German tries to crawl away; the crowd blocks his escape, pushing him back into the center.

Speaker: lazar
Dialogue: So did I!

Speaker: riva
Dialogue: If you let him go, he will lead them back here. Tuvia looks at Malbin. What to do?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Ask if he'll promise not to reveal our location. Shimon translates.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Sie mussen versprechen nicht zu sagan wo wir sind. The man looks up at him, pleadingly.

Speaker: german courier
Dialogue: Nein....Nein...

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: He'll say anything. He breaks the stick across the man's back.

Speaker: lazar
Dialogue: We want justice...

Speaker: motl
Dialogue: Justice... Soon it is a chant: "Justice! .Justice!" Tuvia looks at their faces. Only months ago they were decorous, civilized. Now they are hungry, almost feral. Murderous. Bella has been silently watching. She steps into the circle, looks down at the terrified German man.

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: My son's name was David. David Kagan. We SEE now that she is holding a sharpened hoe.

Speaker: riva
Dialogue: My sister's name was Ellie... As she swings the shovel, the CAMERA begins to back away. Miriam steps forward, carrying a large rock.

Speaker: miriam
Dialogue: My husband was Meyer... The group closes in, obscuring our view of the body. Aron can't take any more. He runs off into the woods.

Speaker: motl
Dialogue: My parents, Sol and Raya.

Speaker: avram
Dialogue: For my daughter, Sonya.

Speaker: mordecai
Dialogue: For my mother.

Speaker: rachel
Dialogue: My sister.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: My whole family.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Reeboynoy shel oylum... Lord of the Universe. We have done unspeakable things yet still I seek your mercy... He HEARS something. Malbin waits at the edge of the forest. His face is drawn and pale from what has just happened.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Viktor is here.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: He doesn't look good.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: I could say the same about you. Where'd you get the jacket?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Let's just say the former owner no longer had need of it. Zus winks. The other bodyguards stare impassively.

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: You found these on the prisoner? Tuvia nods. Viktor studies the scout's documents. Tisking.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We can't fight an entire division.

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: The battle on the Eastern Front has begun. The more troops we engage here, the fewer they have to attack the Motherland.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We've done our part for the Motherland.

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: My orders are to take command of all partisan operations. You will bring the rest of your fighters to me.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And the others? Old people, women and children.

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: In war there are casualties.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: And if I refuse?

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: You are officially a deserter. Do you know the policy on dealing with deserters? Viktor unfolds a paper flyer from his pocket.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: I wouldn't show this around. There are some who'd turn you in for less.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: You want them to find Tuvia's camp. Viktor just looks at him.

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: No. So we can keep fighting. Everyone must sacrifice in the struggle.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Those are my brothers.

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: I am your brother! He is your brother! Comrade Zus. Your Jewish sentimentality is heart-warming, but counter-revolutionary. Zus has secretly known he would hear these words. He grips his rifle but holds his tongue.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: ...but the children of Israel were afraid to leave Egypt. Until Moses said, 'Do not trust in me, trust in God.' He will take care of you'  And so tomorrow we celebrate the Passover by sitting around and arguing just as we have done for centuries. Tuvia stares at them, a curious expression on his face. Malbin comes to stand beside him.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Did it see us?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Tomorrow is Passover. Yes?

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: ...How should I know?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Moses. The Exodus. Malbin doesn't get it at first.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: You want to move them all? The old, the sick. They'll never make it. It isn't the first time Tuvia has consigned people to their death, and apparently it won't be the last.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We leave now. Spread the word.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Come, tateh--

Speaker: oppenheim
Dialogue: But my tools-- The SOUND of approaching aircraft. Tuvia searches the sky. Riva pairs each of the elderly with a child. Tamara tucks her newborn under her coat. The SOUND of the approaching aircraft grows LOUDER. People look up, shielding their eyes. Then from out of the sun, two ominous silhouettes:

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Are you alright? Tuvia shakes his head, points to his ears. He cannot hear.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Get them out of the bunkers! Malbin runs off. Asael helps Tuvia to his feet. A nearby explosion SHOWERS THEM with dirt as they CRAWL to safety. The world RAMPS BACK TO NORMAL SPEED at a dizzying rate.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: With Levine and Miriam... There.  And me. Tuvia shakes his head, no.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Everybody out! Now! But the group's natural reaction is to stay huddled in safety

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Don't try to fight... Just slow them down. Then join us. Asael nods. No need for more words. They embrace fiercely. Asael pushes Chaya toward Tuvia.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Take her. She resists, clinging to his arm for a moment.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Come. He forces her to join him and catch up to the others.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: This swamp here...goes...for miles.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Show me.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Oh, my God...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Are the others back yet?  ..Asael? Malbin shakes his head once more. Asael is not coming back. Chaya begins to weep. Riva comforts her.

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: We've got to keep going!

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: The Germans will be here any minute!

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Do we wait...a while?

Speaker: mordecai
Dialogue: We could hide...

Speaker: motl
Dialogue: Yes. Fight!

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: That's crazy! Tuvia is in hell. If he waits for Asael, he risks them all being caught. Suddenly it all falls apart. Tuvia sinks to his knees as if his legs can no longer bear his weight.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Tuvia--? Tuvia can't speak. He has no more answers. Nothing to say. He stares at the impenetrable swamp. The end of the line. The sudden vacuum of leadership is felt by them all. They stare at one another, anxious and rudderless.

Speaker: rona
Dialogue: There are snakes-- Tamara's newborn is crying. She tries to comfort it. An old woman stares at the swamp in terror.

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: We'll put them on our shoulders.

Speaker: bella
Dialogue: Tuvia, what do we do? Oppenheim is petrified. Rona is crying.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: ...He... ..is... ..tired. Malbin hears something, looks up.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You have a weapon? She shows him her revolver. He checks the clip, then looks into her eyes.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Why are we stopping? Everyone turns. It's Asael. Back from the dead. He hands off a wounded comrade to Riva's care.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: In there?

Speaker: rona
Dialogue: It is impossible! More murmuring. Asael raises his voice.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Nothing is impossible! What we have done is impossible! The murmuring quiets. Asael meets Tuvia's eyes. He is literally willing his older brother to be strong for them, as he has been, time and again.

Speaker: rona
Dialogue: But how?

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Not by miracles. By our strength.

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: We don't have enough rope.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: We'll link arms. Make a chain. A human chain.

Speaker: motl
Dialogue: What are you talking about? Tuvia is deeply moved. His little brother has become a man. Once more, he finds his voice.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Each person takes care of the other.  .Give him your belt. Asael nods at Tuvia gratefully. The group is hushed, apprehensive. Then:

Speaker: one man
Dialogue: Removes his belt and offers it to Asael.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: No tracks on land. Get back in. It is almost impossible to make any progress. Especially when one is weak and malnourished.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Come... Shimon can't catch his breath, he just shakes his head, no. He can't go on. Tuvia half-drags, half-carries him onward.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Is he...? Tuvia shakes his head. It's only a matter of time. The Spotter Plane drones overhead.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Take off your glasses. Reflections. Tuvia moves off to check on the others.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: Shimon, listen to me, the physical plane is just an illusion. Only the spiritual plane is real.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: No. The physical plane is where man acts to redeem himself.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: You've redeemed yourself enough, you should shut up now.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Look who's talking about shutting up... I need to tell you something.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: You shouldn't think so much. The world around you is beautiful.

Speaker: malbin
Dialogue: This world?

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: Even this one. Tuvia has come to sit beside Lilka. She leans into him.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We're lost.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: No. ..No. She puts her arms around him.

Speaker: from nearby
Dialogue: The LIGHTS of their fire can be seen flickering through the reeds as the ragged column MOVES SILENTLY past.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Not a sound. Pass the word. We watch as the ORDER is passed down the line. Parents hold hands over their childrens' mouths. Shimon is carried on an improvised litter made of branches.

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: You will hold this crossroads until the brigade has completed its retreat. Zus looks around at the position.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: For how long? Panchenko's orders are never to be questioned.

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: Until you are ordered to withdraw.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: And if we cannot hold the position? Panchenko looks at Gramov, who stands nearby cradling a submachine gun.

Speaker: panchenko
Dialogue: Comrade Gramov will enforce discipline, if necessary. Gramov smiles. The implications are clear: nobody retreats.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: I am so honored, Comrade. Panchenko wheels his horse and gallops off. Zus and his men take cover in the woods. In the distance we can HEAR the unmistakable SOUND of approaching armor. Lova kneels beside Zus.

Speaker: lova
Dialogue: What are we doing here? Zus? Half a mile down the road, A TANK rumbles into view.

Speaker: shulman
Dialogue: What's next...Sinai? Tuvia can't help but laugh. Soon they are all laughing. It ripples throughout the group. Joyous. Contagious. An overwhelming feeling of relief. They are safe. Tuvia lies on the ground. All the adrenaline has suddenly left his body. Then Aron appears, tugging at his sleeve. Shimon is asking for him. Tuvia kneels down beside his teacher, whose eyes are closed. Malbin is weeping quietly. Who will he argue with?

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: .Tuvia...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Right here. Shimon is at the end.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: ...Something...to say...

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Shhhh...

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: ...no...please...  I almost lost...my faith....but you...were sent..by God..to save us.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Ridiculous.

Speaker: shimon
Dialogue: I know... ... But just...in case... .I thank....HIM... .and I thank you. He closes his eyes. It's too much for Tuvia. Hard as he tries, he cannot stop the tears from filling his eyes.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Back to the river! He pushes people down. They cling to the banks, cowering. THOSE WITH WEAPONS take cover, using the embankment as if it were the lip of a trench. They RETURN FIRE -- old men, young women, even some children.

Speaker: up ahead
Dialogue: A stand of trees hides Tuvia from view as he climbs out of the river and heads into the forest. He pulls Malbin down just as A SQUAD OF GERMAN INFANTRY approaches and begins to set up a heavy machine gun.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Only weapons and ammunition! Spread the word. Tuvia hands him the machine gun.

Speaker: asael
Dialogue: Anything else? Tuvia looks at him. Is he fucking with him? Just a little.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Go on. Lilka is carrying a small child.

Speaker: lilka
Dialogue: What about the dead?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Everybody gather your things! We have to get out of the open! Nearby, Aron removes the machine from the tank and hands it to Zus. Bella approaches. Zus embraces her. Tuvia seizes one of the German rifles. He yells to Shulman.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Good question.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: You are going back?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: No. They look at each other. So much unsaid. No time to say it.

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: We've got to build a new camp. Zus nods.

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: Perhaps you have room for one more?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Don't you hear it?

Speaker: zus
Dialogue: What...?

Speaker: tuvia
Dialogue: Nothing. Isn't it beautiful? We HOLD on Tuvia. He has aged ten years in one.

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: Here is money. I can get more. So much more. Take it, please.

Speaker: cab driver
Dialogue: No, no... Indeed, when the CABBIE speaks, though the voice is older and somewhat frail, we recognize it as Tuvia's.

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: What else can I give you, do for you?

Speaker: aged tuvia
Dialogue: Nothing, it isn't necessary. Tears stream down the elderly man's cheeks.

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: We are alive because of you.  My children. His children. So many. .Thousands.

Speaker: aged tuvia
Dialogue: Please, the traffic...

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: Bless you, Tuvia Bielski. May the Lord bless you and keep you all the days of your life.

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: That wasn't a man. That was an angel. As the cab pulls away, the CAMERA CRANES UP until it is lost in an anonymous sea of traffic. These words appear on
